caption:
In the photograph, a man stands in front of a large, detailed diagram or engineering blueprint. The man, dressed in a dark sweater, pants, and a white hard hat, is positioned to the left side of the frame. He has a confident posture with one hand on his hip and the other by his side, wearing glasses that reflect the flash of the camera.

The blueprint behind him is extensive and complex, covering the entire background of the photo. It appears to show plans of an architectural or engineering project with various lines, symbols, and some areas filled with colors like red, yellow, green, and blue, which might indicate different phases or aspects of the project.

The setting gives the impression of being in an office or a workspace dedicated to project planning and development, suggested by the meticulous and industrial nature of the blueprint. The lighting is slightly dim, focusing mainly on the man and the section of the blueprint beside him.
title: G.F. Harris, mine superintendent of Virginia-Pocahontas Coal Company Mine #3 near Richlands, Virginia. He is in his office looking at a map of the mine which produces metallurgical coal for use in steelmaking. The mine is five to six miles square at the 1,200 foot level. Harris is responsible for everything at his mine and reports directly to the company president.
